TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
"Vive la science! Vive la science! VIVE LA SCI-"

[![template_zpsdjjbtcag.jpg](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/template_zpsdjjbtcag.jpg)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/template_zpsdjjbtcag.jpg.html)

![8mfRRXO.png](http://i.imgur.com/8mfRRXO.png)

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> "Pour Kerbfleet ! Pour la science !"

 D'accord, but I liked the sound of 'vive!' better than the literal translation. Anyway, that's what they all yell at *l'Ãƒâ€°cole Polykerbique*, and I`m sticking with it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
- - - Updated - - -

> 
> "Vive la science! Vive la science! VIVE LA SCI-"
> [http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/template_zpsdjjbtcag.jpg](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/template_zpsdjjbtcag.jpg)

 I don`t know that game, but am I to understand they kicked you off the server for yelling "vive la science!" too loud? If so, Yukon, you are my hero! See, if you'd yelled "pour la science!" instead, it wouldn't have been nearly as badS ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Y'know, there is a very fun mod called "Docking sounds". No more "click". It's rather: "ka-CHUNG! CLANG! CLANG! CLANG!" ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Also, of course Clauselle knows how to make *'le booze'* - she's an engineer. *N'est-ce pas?*

I'm always learning so much due to KSP. Today, I learned a new word!

'Yarely' is a very cool word.

Thanks as always, Kuzzter.

Happy landings!

> 
> [...]of course Clauselle knows how to make *'le booze'* - she's an engineer. *N'est-ce pas?*

Oh yes, of course she does--but for some reason she had the "nervous kerbal" look in the Hitchhiker... I guess she must be worried about getting into trouble with M. Dilsby.
- - - Updated - - -

> 
> 'Yarely' is a very cool word.

Isn't it though? A useful tag to help differentiate 'navy' personnel like Dilsby and Gregmore from Air Service types like Jeb and Tedus. One of these days if I want to get some infractions, I'll ask Mister Geschosskopf to supply me some *real* Navy words. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Well we wouldn't want the comic to become boring, would we? My English teacher taught me there are several kinds of conflict in fiction. I don't remember them all, but I think some of the main ones are Kerbal vs. Malfunctioning Equipment, Kerbal vs. Orbital Mechanics, and Kerbal vs. Annoying Other Kerbal.... or something. See, this is why I became an engineer and not a writer. That, and engineers get paid sometimes. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

We humans are a rather unimaginative lot. The ancient Greeks identified those same types of stories and we've never invented any more since.

> 
> Oh yes, of course she does--but for some reason she had the "nervous kerbal" look in the Hitchhiker... I guess she must be worried about getting into trouble with M. Dilsby.

You would love tvtropes.org, if you've never been there. (Warning: infinite time suck!)

Love the song, a couple of words I need to look up though ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Turns out there is no Kerbfleet cavalry branch. Closest thing we have is the KSMC (Kerbfleet Surface Mobility Corps) Technically a branch of the Space Service, they specialize in piloting rovers.

ETA: "From the rolling hills of Du-u-na, to the shores of Laythe's seas...", etc.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-08T20:54:53Z" title="08/08/2015 08:54  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 8, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**

Yeah, I stepped into that from some links you posted, especially "Heroic BSOD", you evil git. I wasted halft a workday looking at that instead of this forum ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

> 
> Love the song, a couple of words I need to look up though ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Turns out there is no Kerbfleet cavalry branch. Closest thing we have is the KSMC (Kerbfleet Surface Mobility Corps) Technically a branch of the Space Service, they specialize in piloting rovers.

Well, it doesn't have to be a cavalry song. I think the spirit of it goes well with any dangerous enterprise. Some Cajun firemen sing "Dans le FD" ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

Of course, this YouTube version was sung by an official French Army choir and put on CDs for international circulation (I have a copy) so is extremely clean. There are, of course, much more bawdy versions true to what the rankers actually sang, if you care to look.

And of course, [another barracksroom ballad.](https://youtu.be/PDwSr2pI7mY)

Before anyone asks--no, Kerbfleet rank and branch of service do NOT appear in my actual persistence file (but wouldn't that be a cool mod? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) ) However those are indeed Melbe's real stats: very brave, very stupid, very badS. No wonder she's always smiling, bless her heart!

 I appreciate the sentiment, and of course the prior +5 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

"Yee-ha! Look at me, I'm a lander!" ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

That was great. This is really a very fun and interesting crew.

Happy landings!

I wonder if I could manage that on Ike, there were a couple of biomes where I did a 'one landing leg and engines' landing just long enough to trigger my science action group, and this sort of approach would let me get the EVA and surface samples that cannot go into the action group...

Nope, Ike has > 20x the gravity of Gilly. Even twice the gravity of Minmus, with higher peaks. Bummer.

(not that I actually need the science mind you)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-10T15:01:41Z" title="08/10/2015 03:01  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 10, 2015</time> by Terwin**

> 
> I wonder if I could manage that on Ike, there were a couple of biomes where I did a 'one landing leg and engines' landing just long enough to trigger my science action group, and this sort of approach would let me get the EVA and surface samples that cannot go into the action group...
> Nope, Ike has > 20x the gravity of Gilly. Even twice the gravity of Minmus, with higher peaks. Bummer.
> 
> (not that I actually need the science mind you)

Oh, I wouldn't bet against a determined EVA maniac. Delta-V map lists 390 m/s to/from a 10km Ike orbit. Jetpack holds about 550. If you started out real low and decelerated just enough so that the kerbonaut could take the impact on his head, he might survive and only spend minimal jetpack fuel. Then if he walked to the top of a peak and hit the jets from there he could certainly make some kind of orbit--or at least get high enough that a passing ship could grab him, like what happened [in this thread.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69175-Mun-Extreme-EVA/page3)

ETA: [A more recent thread on munar jetpacking](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129713-EVA-landing-on-Mun-and-return-to-orbit)

Terwin, I think you should give it a go in sandbox, and maybe put up a Challenge ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Heheh, good ol' Gilly. It would be a very fun place to play if you could warp there at lower altitudes. As it stands, everything moves SO SLOWLY there that I rapidly get aggravated with the place. It takes most of your available playtime to do 1 simple maneuver. It must be that in KSP, General Relativy's time dilation happens at bodies of very low mass, the opposite of here ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

> 
> Heheh, good ol' Gilly. It would be a very fun place to play if you could warp there at lower altitudes. As it stands, everything moves SO SLOWLY there that I rapidly get aggravated with the place. It takes most of your available playtime to do 1 simple maneuver. It must be that in KSP, General Relativy's time dilation happens at bodies of very low mass, the opposite of here ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

Glad to be gone from there now with a full load of fuel in both ships... I would have gone insane, had I not thought to switch POV to the orbiting Scansat or Evestation whenever I had a ship under 8000m (below which only physics warp is allowed, for those who don't know) Somehow always managed to switch back before crashing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

How do you break a ship on Gilly? By falling asleep on the controls, of course!

Yes, I've done that once - turned away for too long and forgot to come back in time.

> 
> How do you break a ship on Gilly? By falling asleep on the controls, of course!

Or by getting too aggressive with thrusting toward the ground to speed up a landing. I had some huge monster of a fuel base going there one time and forgot to put any upwards-facing RCS on it, so had to point at the ground to speed things up. Then it lacked enough control authority to rotate back in time, and hit the ground sideways ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Very stupid, very brave, badS and always smiling? If not for Scientist tag Melbe would be a female clone of Jeb! ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

> 
> Glad to be gone from there now with a full load of fuel in both ships... I would have gone insane, had I not thought to switch POV to the orbiting Scansat or Evestation whenever I had a ship under 8000m (below which only physics warp is allowed, for those who don't know) Somehow always managed to switch back before crashing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Tip: you can set a KAC alarm for when you reach a distance above a body (in the rendevous tab). I use it all the time for aerobrake alarms, but if you set it a touch over the highest peaks of a planetoid you will always get a notice before it crashes.

Three more pages for today! Lots happening around Eve orbit, almost faster than I can cut and paste....

***FOUR*** round trips to the surface of Gilly, plus multiple rendezvous as well? GAAAHHHH!!!!! I'd have done 1 and then HyperEdited the rest ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

Good luck to die Dipperkraft....
